thread.title: Johnson leads youthful group at Alabama
thread.title_full: Johnson leads youthful group at Alabama

title: Johnson leads youthful group at Alabama
text:
Johnson leads youthful group at Alabama Alabama basketball held it's tenth practice of the preseason Published 9:03 PM CDT Oct 15, 2015 
Avery Johnson is 10 practices into his college coaching career at the University of Alabama. 
The former NBA Coach of the Year leads a youthful roster of six newcomers. 
The Crimson Tide return no players that averaged more than 8.2 points per game last season. 
Johnson said his young guys are still adjusting.â€œA lot of it's new to them," Johnson said following Thursday's practice. "There is a greater sense of responsibility on both ends of the floor. Probably more than they've been held responsible in their life. All of those kids are working hard. Dazon [Ingram] at the point, trying to quarterback the team. Especially, playing for me, he probably has the toughest situation." 
"It's great because he played 16 yeas [in the NBA] and he knows how to coach the guards," Ingram said. "I just listen to him and try to do what he says." 
Alabama opens the season at home on Nov. 13 against Kennesaw State.
